meanings.definition: The quality of retaining or remembering information.
meanings.sent1: Her retentiveness in class helped her ace the exam.
meanings.sent2: His retentiveness of historical facts impressed the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The retentiveness of the computer's memory was unmatched.
meanings.sent4: The retentiveness of the sponge soaked up all the spilled water.
meanings.sent5: The retentiveness of the bookworm's mind was like a steel trap.

meanings.definition: The ability to hold onto or keep something.
meanings.sent1: The retentiveness of the glue kept the pieces together.
meanings.sent2: His retentiveness of his favorite toy was admirable.
meanings.sent3: The retentiveness of the squirrel's grip on the nut was comical.
meanings.sent4: The retentiveness of the magnet attracted all the metal objects.
meanings.sent5: The retentiveness of the spider's web caught all the insects.
